meanings.definition: A book containing the daily prayers, psalms, and readings for the Divine Office.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, the monk opened his breviary to recite the prayers.
meanings.sent2: The breviary was filled with beautiful verses and hymns for each day.
meanings.sent3: The breviary seemed to whisper ancient prayers as it was opened.
meanings.sent4: Her breviary was a treasure trove of spiritual wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The worn pages of the breviary held centuries of devotion within them.

meanings.sent1: The student created a breviary of key points for the exam.
meanings.sent2: His notes served as a helpful breviary for the complex topic.
meanings.sent3: The breviary of the story left out all the exciting parts!
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the map was a breviary of the entire journey.
meanings.sent5: The breviary of facts made studying much easier for the students.
